subject: Re: Senior Quikscript
msgSnippet: It may be best that your husband first learn Junior Quikscript to see if he has an appreciation for the Quikscript alphabet and spelling before having him
messageBody:
It may be best that your husband first learn Junior Quikscript to see if he has an appreciation for the Quikscript alphabet and spelling before having him attempt to learn the rules for Senior Quikscript.

One possibility is to scan your writings and E-Mail that rather then to type out words, as reading handwritten text is different then reading computer-printed text.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "karaiah" <ipray.cj@...> wrote:
>
> Hey all.
>
> I am trying to teach my husband how to read my Quikscript handwriting by sending him an email every day with words to practice reading. However, I write in Senior Quikscript, and the text input I'm using (see the file already on this site) is Junior. Really, it looks like >everything< is Junior. Is there any kind of beta font or text input program out there to type in Senior?
>
> Thanks!
>
